record.title: ORDERS FOR MONDAY, OCTOBER 22, 2007
record.narrative:
ORDERS FOR MONDAY, OCTOBER 22, 2007 -- (Senate - October 19, 2007)

[Page: S13167]

speaking.paragraph: Madam President, I ask unanimous consent that when the Senate completes its business today, it stand adjourned until Monday, October 22; that following the prayer and the pledge, the Journal of proceedings be approved to date, the morning hour be deemed expired, the time for the two leaders be reserved for their use later in the day, and then there be a period of morning business until 3 p.m., with the time equally divided and controlled between the two leaders or their designees, with Senators permitted to speak for up to 10 minutes each; that at 3 p.m. the Senate resume consideration of H.R. 3043.

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.
